Given your interest in war genre movies, I'd highly recommend "The Last Samurai" and "Windtalkers".

In "The Last Samurai", Tom Cruise plays a mercenary who finds himself caught up in the conflict between traditional Japanese samurais and modernizing forces during the Meiji Restoration. It's a powerful story of cultural clash and personal transformation.

"Windtalkers" is another war film, this time set during World War II. Two U.S. Marines are assigned to protect Navajo Marines whose native language is used as an unbreakable radio cypher. The movie offers a unique perspective on the war and the role of indigenous peoples in it. Both films should provide a compelling viewing experience for you!
